name: patchily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that only exists or happens in some parts or situations: Banking services are patchily distributed in the smaller towns. The ban has been applied patchily by the courts.
in a way that is sometimes good and sometimes bad: This is a patchily entertaining TV series. The performance started well, went downhill, and continued rather patchily thereafter. See
patchy
More examplesFewer examplesThe birds' nesting sites are patchily distributed.The sunlight streamed patchily through the dirty windows.For a while the mobile phone network sprang patchily back to life. The strike was only patchily supported.There are child protection laws, but they are only patchily enforced.Their debut album is patchily impressive. Waterford played patchily to defeat Laois.
